source: # Mining - Congo
Datasets from IPIS open data and World Resources Institute.

import geopandas
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Read the mining site data
mining_area = geopandas.read_file("ipis_cod_mines.geojson")

# Print the first rows and the CRS information
print(mining_area.head())
print(mining_area.crs)

# Make a quick visualisation
mining_area.plot()
plt.show()
# national park data
natural_congo = geopandas.read_file("./congo-democratic-republic-latest/gis_osm_natural_free_1.shp")

# First rows and the CRS information
print(natural_congo.head())
print(natural_congo.crs)

#Quick visualisation
natural_congo.plot()
plt.show()
### Convert to common CRS to UTM projection

# Plot the natural_congo and mining area data
ax = natural_congo.plot()
mining_sites.plot(ax=ax, color='red')
plt.show()

# Convert both datasets to UTM projection
mining_area_utm = mining_area.to_crs(epsg=32735)
natural_congo_utm = national_parks.to_crs(epsg=32735)

# Plot the converted data again
ax = natural_congo_utm.plot()
mining_area_utm.plot(ax=ax, color='red')
plt.show()

#Converted data to a file
# mining_area_utm.to_file("ipis_cod_mines_utm.gpkg", driver='GPKG')
# natural_congo_utm.to_file("gis_osm_natural_free_1_utm.shp", driver='ESRI Shapefile')

# Plot of the natural and mining area
ax = natural_congo.plot(color='green')
mining_area.plot(ax=ax, markersize=5)
plt.show()

# Natural and mining areas
ax = natural_congo.plot(color='green')
mining_area.plot(ax=ax, markersize=5, alpha=0.5)
ax.set_axis_off()
plt.show()
### Buffer operation around Points
How many mining sites are located within 50 km of Makanga?
And how much area of national park?

# goma is a Point
makanga = mining_area.loc[0 , 'geometry']
print(type(makanga))
# Create a buffer of 50km around Mount Mikeno
makanga_buffer = makanga.buffer(50000)
# The buffer is a polygon
print(type(makanga.buffer))

# Check how many sites are located within the buffer
masque = mining_area.within(makanga_buffer)
print(masque.sum())
Which of the mining sites are located within this national park?
# Extract the single polygon for the Makanga National park
makanga = natural_congo[natural_congo['name'] == "Makanga"].geometry.squeeze()

source:
# In which national park a mining site is located
sites_within_natural = geopandas.sjoin(mining_area, natural_congo, op='within', how='inner')
print(sites_within_natural.head())
#Number of mining sites in each national park
# print(sites_within_natural['name'].value_counts())
# Get the geometry of the first row
single_minesite = mining_area.geometry[0]
# Distance from each natural_area to this mine
dist = natural_congo.distance(single_minesite)
# The index of the minimal distance
idx = dist.idxmin()

# Access the name of the corresponding park
closest_park = natural_congo.loc[idx, 'name']
print(closest_park)

# Define a function that returns the closest national park
def closest_natural_congo(geom, natural_congo):
    dist = natural_congo.distance(geom)
    idx = dist.idxmin()
    closest_park = natural_congo.loc[idx, 'name']
    return closest_park
# Call the function on the single mine
print(closest_natural_congo(single_minesite, natural_congo))

source:
# Apply the function to all mining sites
mining_area['closest_park'] = mining_area.geometry.apply(closest_natural_congo, natural_congo=natural_congo)
print(mining_area.head())
